page.title: 04The Sawmill
page.content: The sawmill was built in 1928. Then after a time it closed. It opened again in 1940. They make{fencing posts {and panels.}They use oak butts for the panels. They also make{pit props}for the mines in{South Wales, pallets}for {North America, ash elevators}to carry bails on farms and{packing cases}for {Parmiters.}They make{building {materials}like{beams}to support the roof and{expensive kitchen furniture made from{oak. They use{softwood}and{oak}mostly. The big saw is almost two metres in diameter. They get most of the wood from{Guilford}and{Cornwall.}Some of their goods are sent to the{Far East. {Four}people are employed there at the moment.
